The transitions between characters can be represented as an array. Let's define an array T where T[i] is 1 if S[i] ! = S[i+1], else 0. The transitions array has length n-1. The number of transitions in a substring from l to r (inclusive) is equal to the sum of T[l], T[l+1], ..., T[r-1].
